Chris Croome <chris@...> writes:

> Hi
> 
> On Wed 26-Feb-2003 at 05:06:44PM +0000, Nic Ferrier wrote:
> >
> > No... 401 is authentication challenge. Whenever the UA recieves an
> > authentication challenge it should respond with whatever auth
> > details it has got.
> 
> My confusion is how people set things up on the server side so that
> after a client has, by mistake, typed the wrong passwd, and
> submitted it they can be re-prompted for a username and passwd
> again.

It's very curious this. I've _never_ had this problem, not even with
commercial software. I'm using moz on linux as well, before that I
used mainly navigator 4.x

When my basic auth apps want to log someone out they send a 401 even
when the user is already passing in a WWW-Authenticate header.

The behaviour I see, and what I think is correct, is the browser
popping up the window again.


When I find time I'll construct and easily replicatable test for this
and send it to you. It might be interesting to get to the bottom of
the problem.


Nic
